channel.title: Comments on: Start
channel.description: Official site of the House of Whack Board Game

item.title: By: mis mistress
item.dc:creator: mis mistress
item.description: it is the two different "end" cards with different views of the same room that got me. so if you walk into the top part of the "end" room, are you essentially floating one level above the coffin or do you end up in the coffin?
item.content:encoded: it is the two different “end” cards with different views of the same room that got me. so if you walk into the top part of the “end” room, are you essentially floating one level above the coffin or do you end up in the coffin?

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: Mechanically, you are looking down into the room, like it is part of a floor plan. Stylistically, the illustration is there to inspire you as to what you might find in that room. A few of the rooms, such as the hallways, are literal top down representations of the room.
item.content:encoded: Mechanically, you are looking down into the room, like it is part of a floor plan. Stylistically, the illustration is there to inspire you as to what you might find in that room. A few of the rooms, such as the hallways, are literal top down representations of the room.

item.title: By: Mis Mistress
item.dc:creator: Mis Mistress
item.description: what is the intended orientation of the room cards? i know they are placed on the table and you look down to see the room. but is the room card a representation of the whole 3d room, or the walls or the floors? is the grid on each card a window or a glass-like plane? is it an imaginative maze orientation similar to the one in the movie "labyrinth" or the movie "the cube"? are you walking IN to a room or falling down into a room or just observing a room looking through a window?
item.content:encoded: what is the intended orientation of the room cards? i know they are placed on the table and you look down to see the room. but is the room card a representation of the whole 3d room, or the walls or the floors? is the grid on each card a window or a glass-like plane? is it an imaginative maze orientation similar to the one in the movie “labyrinth” or the movie “the cube”? are you walking IN to a room or falling down into a room or just observing a room looking through a window?
